txt.en: The entrance to Writhenset can be found in the West-delf and East-delf.\n\nYou should enter Writhenset, defeat the mining leaders, and repair support beams.
Rubble can be found in Writhenset.\n\nYou should clear the rubble to see what was in this section of the mine.

'Ah, you are back from the mining survey. How did it go? I see, you were met with some hostility from brigands and Orcs. I am not surprised that they look to pillage the old mine.'

You ask about the League's intentions for the mine of Writhenset.

'Why we wish to make the mine safe once again and extract stone for trade. I hope that is acceptable to you.'

You now judge Enid of honourable character and relinquish the information you have been holding close about the less than reputable actions of Nye Crowfoot and Addy Rushtuft as well as the hidden tomb of Arnor.

'I see. I have had my suspicions about those two but did not have any proof to expel them from the League. I have been sending you on expeditions with them to monitor their actions in the Wildwood. I knew I judged your character as true and could trust you. We must now keep an even closer eye on Nye and Addy. Now as for this hidden tomb, the League of the Axe is not comprised of tomb-robbers. I have no interest in an old tomb. If we work in the mines however, we will proudly protect and preserve the tomb.'

'Yes, I'm Addy Rushtuft. Are you here for the survey expedition? Good to hear! There's some nefarious folk at the East-delf and West-delf of Writhenset. Let's begin by making life in the Wildwood difficult for them. Destroying their supplies and mined stones should complete that task! Then we'll be able to get into the mines without a problem.'
Enid Nettlesting can be found at Trader's Wharf.\n\nYou should talk to Enid Nettlesting.

'You have done much for the League of the Axe since last we spoke, [placeholder]. How would you like to join a mining survey? Addy Rushtuft here is leading a survey expedition to Writhenset, in the Wildwood. Speak to her when you are ready and she will fill you in with the details.'

'Great work, [placeholder]. Looks like we sent those scoundrels running! Now is our chance to enter the mines. I'd like you to challenge the foreman and overseer of Writhenset. I'm sure they deserve what's coming to them. While you're at it, why don't you weaken some of the support beams in there? That will send a message, all right!'

You are taken aback by Addy Rushtuft's words and see now that she is no more honourable than Nye Crowfoot. You agree to assist Addy but form your own plan as you continue to question the reputable nature of the League of the Axe.

'All right, [placeholder], into the mines we go.'
A large rumble can be felt throughout the mine!
What were these tomb-robbers digging for in the mine before the tunnel collapsed?
Addy Rushtuft can be found at Trader's Wharf.\n\nYou should talk to Addy Rushtuft.
The League of the Axe is leading a mining expedition in the Wildwood.
Cut stones and mining supplies can be found at the West-delf and East-delf in the Wildwood.\n\nYou should destroy the cut stones and mining supplies found in the West-delf and East-delf.
The cave-in seems to have come near the West-delf entrance in Writhenset.\n\nYou should find the source of the cave-in.
Addy Rushtuft wishes to meet up near the West-delf in the Wildwood to mine the hills.\n\nYou should talk to Addy Rushtuft in the Wildwood.
Find the source of the cave-in
Talk to Addy Rushtuft near the West-delf in the Wildwood
The cave-in seems to have come near the West-delf entrance in Writhenset.\n\nYou should find the source of the cave-in.
Find the source of the cave-in
Rubble can be found in Writhenset.\n\nYou should clear the rubble to see what was in this section of the mine.
